intro.p: The GStreamer team is proud to announce the third bugfix release in the stable 1.8 release series of your favourite cross-platform multimedia framework!
This release only contains bugfixes and it is safe to update from 1.8.x. For a full list of bugfixes see Bugzilla.
See &site;/releases/1.8/ for the full release notes.

This module, gstreamer, only contains core functionality. For actual media playback, you will need other modules.
gst-plugins-base contains a basic set of well-supported plugins gst-plugins-good contains a set of well-supported plugins under our preferred license gst-plugins-ugly contains a set of well-supported plugins, but might pose problems for distributors gst-plugins-bad contains a set of less supported plugins that haven't passed the rigorous quality testing we expect, or are still missing documentation and/or unit tests gst-libav contains a set of codecs plugins based on libav (formerly gst-ffmpeg)

bug.summary: basesink: Stepping incorrectly updates start time when stepping in PAUSED, causing step amount to be calculated wrongly
Probe only flush events, is not possible
tee: Properly handle return value when only 1 pad
queue2: fix crash deleting current region for small ring buffers
Building GStreamer for Android fails on Windows (new since 1.8.2)
pad: check caps not NULL before referring
queue2: Force final average input rate calculation on EOS
queue2: Post buffering messages earlier in ringbuffer mode
